Job Title: Product Owner II - General Motors Insurance/OSI

Location: Fort Worth, TX

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Marketing, Product Management

Description:
Overview

Why GM Insurance/OnStar Insurance?

At OnStar Insurance, we are building an Insurtech business that will reinvent auto insurance. We are fully owned and backed by auto industry leaders General Motors and GM Financial. This is a truly unique opportunity to join at the foundational stage of a start-up leading the transformation of the auto insurance experience.

GM has the largest connected vehicle fleet worldwide. In the US alone, there are currently 9M+ connected GM vehicles on the road and that number is projected to triple in the next 10 years. More than that, the OnStar system currently has access to over 900 data points from the vehicle. This surge in information about vehicles and how they are driven will revolutionize auto insurance. This disruption is backed by the bold GM vision of zero crashes, zero emissions and zero congestion. We are serious about the safety and financial security of our customers.

If you are passionate about driving innovation and delivering results in a fast-paced, value-focused environment, OnStar Insurance is looking for you. As a Product Owner, you will play a pivotal role in the success of our cutting-edge API Platform Engineering team. This role goes beyond traditional Product Owner responsibilities, embracing the challenges of API software development and architecture in a dynamic, technology-driven landscape.

Responsibilities

About the role

As a member of the team, you will lead the strategic direction and development of C# microservices in Azure, ensuring that our middleware tier seamlessly integrates with front-end applications, back-end core systems, and third-party integrations. As a visionary, you will be instrumental in shaping the future of OnStar Insurance's middleware solutions, aligning your work with overarching business goals.

Your responsibilities will extend to fostering a robust DevSecOps culture and prioritizing security and operational excellence in our software development process. As a collaborative liaison, you will coordinate closely between Product Management and Product Delivery teams, maintaining the platform/team backlog and leading backlog prioritization of initiatives. Your efforts will be key in aligning experiences across various channels and touchpoints, guaranteeing the best business outcomes.

This role demands a unique blend of technical expertise, strategic thinking, and leadership skills. You will be at the forefront of driving innovation, managing risks, and mentoring a team of talented professionals, all while ensuring the resilience and supportability of our applications. Join us to contribute significantly to our journey towards technological excellence and customer-centric solutions at OnStar Insurance.

Qualifications

What makes you a dream candidate?

Develop and communicate a clear vision for the API platform, aligning with organizational strategies. Identify future opportunities in API technology and middleware solutions.Analyze and communicate customer requirements to provide innovative solutions. Focus on createing novel solutions with measurable value for both existing and potential customers.Direct and coordinate the development of C# microservices in Azure, focusing on supporting front-end applications and core systems integrations. Ensure the best business results by aligning experiences across channels and touchpoints.Foster a strong DevSecOps culture, emplasizing security and operational excellence. Act as a member of an Agile Scrum team, maximizing the output of the development team through effective backlog prioritization and evaluation of work.Serve as a collaborative liasion between Product Management and Product Delivery teams. Communicate effectively with all levels of leadership, internal business partners, and external vendors regarding project status and performance.Leverage innovation tools, creative processes, and diverse cross-functional experts to generate ideas. Continuously improve processes, products, and services. Explore alternative problem-solving methods to achieve results beyond standard expectations.Proactively manage risks and dependencies in the product development lifecycle. Ensure compliance with security standards and company policies. Establish and monitor KPIs for the API platform. Measure product performance using key information processes and systems to ensure accountability for achieving business results.Work closely with UX/UI designers, system architects, and business analysts to ensure a cohesive product development approach. Craft high-quality, customer-centric user stories that exceed customer expectations. Manage the scope of each product launch for on-time delivery of key features. Adapt to changing technologies and business environments. Take immediate action when confronted with a problem or made aware of a situation. 

Experience And Education

2-4 years experience as a Product Owner/Manager on an Agile Scrum teamHigh School Diploma or equivalent requiredBachelor’s Degree or additional equivalent work or military experience preferred

Licenses

Agile Certification (PSPO or CSP-PO or POPM/APM) required

What We Offer: Generous benefits package available on day one to include: 401K matching, bonding leave for new

parents (12 weeks, 100% paid), tuition assistance, training, GM employee auto discount, community service pay and

nine company holidays.

Our Culture: Our team members define and shape our culture — an environment that welcomes innovative ideas,

fosters integrity, and creates a sense of community and belonging. Here we do more than work — we thrive.

Compensation: Competitive pay and bonus eligibility

Work Life Balance: Remote work enviornment

Salary

The base salary range for this role is: USD $77,900.00 to $144,100.00. At GM Financial, we strive for transparency in all aspects of our business, including pay equity. This is the GM Financial pay range for this role and job level. The exact salary and compensation will vary based on factors like knowledge, skills, experience, and education. This role is eligible to participate in a performance-based incentive plan. Full time employees are eligible to participate in health benefits on day one of employment.

Experience Level (if available): Director
